review_title: Don’t do it!!! Run for the hills!!!
pros: There are absolutely none !
cons: * Higher-ups are lazy and want you to do their job, without any compensation. * You don’t get paid enough * They don’t take you seriously * Some team members don’t do their job, so you’re having to do extra work * Get treated like garbage by any, and everyone * Higher-ups don’t assist team when in need but micromanage instead * Very disorganized * All in all I would not recommend that you work here, unless you’re looking to quit within a month or two. The pay MAYBE alright but it’s not worth the hell that they’ll put you through. I don’t ever write reviews but I wanted to save someone the time and energy from making the same mistake I did. This place is a walking red flag, just go into the place and ask any employee if it’s worth working here and they’ll say no. This place has such a high turnover rate, because higher ups treat us badly. Within the years that I have worked there I have seen many people leave within 2 months, I wish I can say I was joking but I’m not. You try to talk to them about something and they dismiss your thought. Higher-ups talk about team work when THEY’RE the worst at it. They can’t come down to help out ever, and then get mad when things hit the fan when we are completely understaffed. They have certain things that THEY need to do but instead send it to us to do when we don’t have the time to do it when that is NOT in the job description, but in THEIRS. They’re the most hypocritical,lazy, judgmental people I’ve ever met. When I say run the other way I mean it, I wish someone would’ve done that for me. If I could give this god forsaken place zero stars I would.

pros: It’s a Good teaching facility.
cons: Pay could be better and medi tech is so outdated.

pros: RT dept. is team oriented and friendly.
cons: This hospital does not understand how to staff respiratory therapists. The respiratory department also does mid shift counts to see if they can send employees home which takes time away from actual patient care. I believe that the focus of this hospital is to see how minimal they can keep staff to pocket more money. The low staffing for the respiratory department has set low standards when it comes to patient care. This leads to unsafe practices for RTs and dangerous conditions for patients. RTs are expected to manage an insane amount of patients which leaves no time to preform adequate patient assessments. In addition, respiratory therapists would need to “cut corners” to be able to get charting done by the end of the shift. Don’t expect to stay after your shift to get charting done because you will have a trip to the director’s office.

pros: I wouldnt recommend working here
cons: Management is horrible. Don’t work here.

pros: Medical Center of Arlington has open minded management, excellent physicians,  and a friendly atmosphere to work in.  I highly recommend working at this medical center.
cons: Medical Center of Arlington does have a lacking benefit program.  Also the attendance policy is strict. Employees are only allowed 3 absences in a rolling year.   Unfortunately most of our illnesses areobtained at the hospital.  At least our FMLA law stands by our side.

pros: There are many nice people that work there. Other departments are very respectful.
cons: The engineering director threatens to replace his staff at least once a week. He takes everything personally and does not put what is best for the hospital first. Very low pay and hospital infrastructure in extremely poor condition. Back stabbing and personal sabotage abounds. Zero training and acclimation. Had to threaten to quit my first day just to get the director to have someone show me rounds and mechanical rooms. A few good employees but not worth the nightmare.  Retaliation by director expected.

review_title: Nurses are not given the support they need

cons: PCAs take no responsibility and more times than not create more work for nurses.  Upper management provides no support and appear to have no idea what it is their nurses go through to provide care.
